name: linear_matroid_parity
chinese_name: 浅谈信息学竞赛中的线图问题
author: 翟锦程
complexity: O(mr^2) for unweighted, O(Vmn^3 log^2(Vn)) for weighted where V is the maximum weight
summary: The paper discusses the Linear Matroid Parity Problem (LMPP), a generalization of classical combinatorial optimization problems such as maximum matching in general graphs and network flow. It presents a randomized algebraic algorithm based on matrix rank computation using compact and sparse constructions, with applications to various problems including weighted versions and constrained spanning trees.
